what: 1. Exporting & reproducing the data to work further
title: Exporting data and Wrapping Up the Session
text: dataviewR provides additional benefit allowing download copy data working , making easy export analysis, model building, visualization. download data, user can use download option provided .csv .xlsx formats. copy data, user requested use copy option provided. copy/download feature applies rows currently visible page viewing. dataviewR uses callr package run shiny application background process. manage retrieve information active dataviewR sessions, following helper functions available. list_dataviewers ‚Üí Lists active dataviewR sessions. stop_dataviewer ‚Üí stop specific recent dataviewR session. stop_all_dataviewers‚Üí stop active dataviewR sessions.

title: Exporting data and Wrapping Up the Session
text: list_dataviewers provides information active sessions.
code: list_dataviewers() Active background dataviewer processes: =======================================  ID: dv_11   Status: RUNNING   Data: iris, mtcars   Port: 5281   Started: 2025-11-30 18:51:49

title: Exporting data and Wrapping Up the Session
text: stop recent dataviewR session user can simply use stop_dataviewer function default stops recent active session. stop specific recent dataviewR session, user can use stop_dataviewer providing id session. code stops session mentioned id argument. stop active sessions user needs use stop_all_dataviewers
code: stop_dataviewer() id <- dataviewer(mtcars, iris) dataviewer(id = id) stop_all_dataviewers()

title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: Filtering dataviewR done using single powerful method: writing dplyr compatible expression filter box. gives complete flexibility keeping logic clean reproducible.

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: app opens, ‚Äôll see Filter text box can type valid expression similar dplyr::filter().
code: library(dataviewR)  dataviewer(iris)

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: can write filtering condition normally pass : Basic comparisons Multiple conditions Using %% Handling missing values String matching click Submit, expression evaluated dataset updates. Invalid expressions show friendly error notification.
code: dplyr::filter(...) Sepal.Length > 5 Sepal.Length > 5 & Species == "virginica" Species %in% c("setosa", "virginica") is.na(Petal.Width) grepl("^s", Species)

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: Submit ‚Üí runs filter Clear ‚Üí resets filter box Load ‚Üí reloads data selections reset display updates immediately submitting.

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
what: 4. How filtering affects the generated R code
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: Whenever apply filter, exported code reflects exactly typed: Filtering always appears column selection generated R code.
code: iris |>   filter(Species == "setosa" & Sepal.Length > 5) |>   select(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Species)

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: Use & instead && Use %% selecting multiple values Variable names case-sensitive Treat filter box like dplyr::filter() function something fails, try running expression directly R console first

previous_headings: Filtering & Expressions in dataviewR
what: 6. Note on Quick Filter and Quick Search
title: Using Filter and Expressions
text: quick filter box (placed variable name) helps quickly search value variable. character/factor variable(s) - shows distinct values variable(s) including NA values. numeric variable(s) - shows interactive draggable slider minimum maximum values variable(s). reflect generated R code filtering logic solely depends Filter expression box. present, NA values numeric variables appear blanks per DT package formatting shall fixed future enhancement. quick search box allows quickly check whether value exists dataset. searches within variable values, variable names/attributes.

text: article, learned:  - dataviewR uses expression-based filtering system  - Expressions must valid similar dplyr::filter() function  - filtered result updates Submit  - Exported code reflects filter exactly  - Quick filters help browsing contribute filtering logic Expression filtering gives users full flexibility keeps workflow reproducible.

title: Introduction to dataviewR
text: dataviewR provides clean intuitive Shiny interface interactively exploring R data frames tibbles. Instead using default View() utils package writing temporary filter code, can open dataset visually, browse structure, filter rows, inspect values, export results ‚Äî within seconds. Unlike View(), dataviewR dynamically reflect dataset altered RStudio loaded.

title: Introduction to dataviewR
text: Whether work clinical research, data analysis, academia, strong understanding datasets important. dataviewR helps : Inspect datasets interactively within seconds View two datasets side--side Review data quality structure analysis functions like View() offer quick static snapshot dataset, limited working large datasets, inspecting variable values, applying interactive filters. dataviewR offers flexible, dynamic interface enables efficient intuitive data exploration, whether within viewer pane standalone R Shiny application. dataviewR modify values/attributes dataset(s) passed guide walks launch, navigate, work datasets dataviewR. feature-specific articles examples, visit Articles section documentation.

title: Introduction to dataviewR
text: three ways start application, depending workflow:

previous_headings: Launching dataviewR
title: Introduction to dataviewR
text: pass dataset(s), dataviewR opens directly dataset(s) loaded. better user experience, recommended open dataviewR new window Viewer pane. open dataset shiny application, user requested disable background option using background = FALSE argument keeps console busy. ‚Äôll see interactive table immediately, along variable info filtering options.
code: library(dataviewR)  dataviewer(iris) # Opens in RStudio Viewer pane or default web browser  dataviewer(iris, background = FALSE) # Opens the Shiny application and run in foreground to enable the "Import Dataset" tab alongside 'iris'

Please check Exploring Multiple Datasets article examples.

what: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Interactive Feature-Rich Data Viewer R dataviewR powerful Shiny-based interactive data viewer transforms way explore R data frames tibbles. intuitive interface advanced features, provides comprehensive data exploration capabilities automatic code generation reproducible workflows.

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Interactive Data Exploration: View R data.frame tibble elegant Shiny interface Multi-Dataset Support ‚Äî View multiple datasets , e.g., dataviewer(iris, mtcars) Advanced Filtering: Apply complex dplyr compatible filter expressions Dynamic Column Selection: Easily select deselect columns checkbox interface Automatic Code Generation: Generate reproducible dplyr code data manipulations Metadata Display: Access detailed variable information attributes Import Panel: Built-data import functionality data provided Responsive Design: Clean, modern interface works across different screen sizes Export Capabilities: Save filtered selected data analysis complete tutorial package key features explained

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
text: Install stable release CRAN: latest development version GitHub: R-universe (binary builds available):
code: install.packages("dataviewR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("madhankumarnagaraji/dataviewR") install.packages("dataviewR",                   repos = c("https://madhankumarnagaraji.r-universe.dev",                            "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

title: An Interactive and Feature-Rich Data Viewer
code: library(dataviewR)  # Launch with a dataset dataviewer(iris) # Opens the dataset in RStudio Viewer pane or default web browser  # View multiple datasets at once dataviewer(iris, mtcars)  # or launch without data to use the import panel (foreground mode - console will be busy) dataviewer()

what: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
text: Launches Shiny application explore filter data.frame tibble. data provided, opens import panel load dataset either global environment packages.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
code: dataviewer(..., background = NULL, port = NULL)

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
text: ... One data.frame tibble objects. none provided, import UI shown load data interactively. background Logical. TRUE, runs app background R process using callr. Requires callr package. Default TRUE dataset(s) provided, FALSE dataset(s) provided. port Integer. Port number Shiny app. NULL, random available port used. Default NULL.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
text: background = TRUE, returns process ID (character) invisibly. background = FALSE, returns Shiny application object.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
text: function provides: tab-based interface data import viewer options. Support multiple datasets separate tabs. checkbox panel select/deselect columns. input dplyr-compatible filter expressions. dynamically generated dplyr code preview. Metadata display variables. filtering uses dplyr::filter() generates user-friendly code replicate steps. also provides copyable R code includes column selection filtering logic.

title: Interactive Data Viewer with Filter and Code Generation ‚Äî dataviewer
code: if (interactive()) {     dataviewer(mtcars) # Opens in RStudio Viewer pane or default web browser     dataviewer(iris, mtcars) # Opens multiple datasets in separate tabs     dataviewer() # Opens the "Import Dataset" tab (foreground mode - console will be busy)      # Run in foreground to enable the "Import Dataset" tab alongside 'mtcars'     dataviewer(mtcars, background = FALSE)      # Stop background process     id <- dataviewer(mtcars, iris)     stop_dataviewer(id) }

what: List Active Background Dataviewer Processes ‚Äî list_dataviewers
title: List Active Background Dataviewer Processes ‚Äî list_dataviewers
text: List Active Background Dataviewer Processes

title: List Active Background Dataviewer Processes ‚Äî list_dataviewers

text: Stop Specific Recent Dataviewer Process

title: Stop a Specific or Most Recent Dataviewer Process ‚Äî stop_dataviewer
code: stop_dataviewer(id = NULL)

title: Stop a Specific or Most Recent Dataviewer Process ‚Äî stop_dataviewer
text: id Character string specifying process ID stop. NULL, stops recent background dataviewer.
